citeinfo.origin: Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: Environmental Conditions Near Portlock and Albatross Banks (Gulf of Alaska) May 1972

abstract.p: The extensive oceanographic investigations in the northern North Pacific Ocean and Bering Sea conducted by the Northwest Fisheries Science Center (and its predecessor, the Bureau of Commercial Fisheries Seattle Biological Laboratory) under the supervision of the American Section of the International North Pacific Fisheries Commission were terminated in summer 1971, and the activities of this group were shifted to investigations associated with the newly initiated Marine Resource, Monitoring, Assessment and Prediction program.

[Reference: FAVORITE, F., W. J. INGRAHAM, Jr., and D. M. FISK. 1975. Environmental conditions near Portlock and Albatross Banks (Gulf of Alaska) May 1972. NWFC Processed Rep., 45 p. Northwest Fish. Cent., Natl. Mar. Fish. Serv., NOAA, 7600 Sand Point Way NE, Seattle, WA 98115.]

descript.purpose: To provide environmental conditions near Portlock and Albatross Banks.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
